Job Title: Risk Management Principal

Location: Golden Valley, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

The future is what you make it!

At Honeywell Aerospace Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of thinkers, innovators, and doers help make the future. We build environments and technologies that meet our customers' needs. The groundbreaking scientists, engineers, and professionals that make up our nimble group have the agility of a start-up backed with the power and investment of Honeywell.

Join a team with expertise in physics, cryogenics, complex control systems, cyber security, and more to incubate novel technologies that shape the future! #futureshaper

Honeywell’s ACST team is seeking a Risk Management Principal for our Broomfield, CO location.

Citizenship Required: United States CitizenshipClearance Required: Yes; you must either currently have or be able to obtain and maintain an active U.S. Government security clearanceTelecommute: No - Teleworking not available for this positionTravel Required: Some travel required – 20%Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available

Are you ready to help us make the future?

What’s in it for you?

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell ACST employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance; Short-Term and Long-Term Disability; 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance; Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation and/or personal business), and 12 Paid Holidays. A relocation package is available to support your move to one of our locations. This role is also eligible for both a discretionary incentive bonus and a performance-based incentive in addition to base pay.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement program protection strategies and plansAssess risks and vulnerabilities and recommend security measuresCollaborate with project/program teams to ensure compliance with security requirementsConduct security assessments and auditsProvide guidance and training on security best practicesStay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging threats

Us Citizenship Requirements

Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

You Must Have

Minimum of 5 years of experience in risk management or a related fieldStrong experience in risk assessment and mitigationKnowledge of security principles and best practicesExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsU.S. citizenship to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Compensation & Benefits

Incentive EligibleSalary Range: $149,000 - $186,000For benefits information, please visit - https://benefits.honeywell.com/.Current employees may visit HR Direct.

This role will remain open for applications until an offer is accepted or position is cancelled.

We Value

We value candidates who may have one or more of the following skills:

Bachelor's degree or greater from an accredited institutionAble to quickly understand processes and ensure adherence to the sameMust be able to deploy a systematic approach to work and must have an aptitude for performing work functions in a timely and well-organized manner with limited oversightAdapt to constantly changing work assignments, consistently make timely decisions while balancing conflicting goals with decisiveness in an ambiguous environmentAbility to work in a fast-paced, autonomously driven, and demanding start-up-like atmosphereParticipation in a culture of excellence and teamworkAbility to clearly and concisely conveys subtle or complex messages to a variety of audiences, both written and verbal

#ACST

Additional Information

Global (ALL)

Experience Level (if available): Director
